result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED 
and gave defendant copy of Bond Addendum and Scheduling Information

Assistant District Attorney Joshua Dryak appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Kevin Alfred Martin and Cameron Jeffery Hofer appear via Zoom. Defense requests GPS removed. State objects. Court removes SCRAM condition, however, defendant must report to CJS on today's date and comply with their requirements.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Absolute sobriety. Court removes SCRAM condition, however, defendant must report to CJS on today's date and comply with their requirements.

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Kevin Alfred Martin and Cameron Jeffery Hofer appear via Zoom. Defense to request SCRAM removal at next hearing. Present bond continued
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Assistant District Attorney Meranda Hillmann appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Kevin Alfred Martin and Cameron Jeffery Hofer appear via Zoom. Defense requests SCRAM removed. State objects. Court denies bond modification. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on June 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Deputy District Attorney Caleb Saunders appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Cameron Jeffery Hofer appears with attorney Kevin Alfred Martin via Zoom. Defendant pleads not guilty to all counts.  Present bond continued  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on April 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:00 AM Defendant Cameron Jeffery Hofer in court with attorney Kevin Alfred Martin.  Asst. District Attorney John Luetscher appears on behalf of the State.  Present bond continued  Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
